title: Phenology of Mangroves
text: Mangrove forests are salt-tolerant trees and shrubs that thrive in intertidal zones of tropical and subtropical regions. These ecosystems are highly valued as blue carbon reservoirs and natural coastal protection systems. Within mangrove ecosystems, different species display significant diversity in tree structures, growth strategies, and environmental adaptations. While mangroves are evergreen, remote sensing observations reveal that distinct species exhibit varying temporal patterns in the onset, persistence, and greenness of their growth stages. This study aims to characterize the phenological patterns of three mangrove species: red mangrove (Rhizophora mangle), white mangrove (Avicennia germinans), and black mangrove (Laguncularia racemosa) in Everglades National Park, Florida. To be more specific, high-temporal-resolution remote sensing data from the Harmonized Landsat and Sentinel (HLS) dataset for 2023 will be used to extract Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) values, enabling a detailed analysis of the phenological differences among these dominant species. test

title: Phenology of Mangroves
section: Download and clean all required data
text:
Download and clean all required data

Install and load necessary packages

library(terra)
library(ggplot2)
library(sf)
library(leaflet)
library(RColorBrewer)



Three mangrove species samples

#read shapefiles of three mangrove species in Florida
black_mangrove <- st_read("data/SpeciesSamples/BM_Samples.shp")

Reading layer `BM_Samples' from data source 
  `/home/runner/work/final-project-jingmiao7/final-project-jingmiao7/data/SpeciesSamples/BM_Samples.shp' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 10 features and 1 field
Geometry type: POINT
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 466246 ymin: 2779986 xmax: 502432.2 ymax: 2854372
Projected CRS: NAD83 / UTM zone 17N

white_mangrove <- st_read("data/SpeciesSamples/WM_Samples.shp")

Reading layer `WM_Samples' from data source 
  `/home/runner/work/final-project-jingmiao7/final-project-jingmiao7/data/SpeciesSamples/WM_Samples.shp' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 10 features and 1 field
Geometry type: POINT
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 464094.6 ymin: 2783839 xmax: 499619.2 ymax: 2860301
Projected CRS: NAD83 / UTM zone 17N

red_mangrove <- st_read("data/SpeciesSamples/RM_Samples.shp")

Reading layer `RM_Samples' from data source 
  `/home/runner/work/final-project-jingmiao7/final-project-jingmiao7/data/SpeciesSamples/RM_Samples.shp' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 10 features and 1 field
Geometry type: POINT
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 463689.7 ymin: 2786536 xmax: 522674.7 ymax: 2849480
Projected CRS: NAD83 / UTM zone 17N

crs_target <- st_crs(4326) # WGS 84
black_mangrove <- st_transform(black_mangrove, crs_target)
white_mangrove <- st_transform(white_mangrove, crs_target)
red_mangrove <- st_transform(red_mangrove, crs_target)

colors <- c("Black Mangrove" = "black", 
            "White Mangrove" = "white", 
            "Red Mangrove" = "red")

leaflet() %>%
  addTiles() %>%
  addCircleMarkers(data = black_mangrove, 
                   color = "black", 
                   radius = 5, 
                   popup = ~paste("Black Mangrove<br>", as.character(geometry))) %>%
  addCircleMarkers(data = white_mangrove, 
                   color = "white", 
                   radius = 5, 
                   popup = ~paste("White Mangrove<br>", as.character(geometry))) %>%
  addCircleMarkers(data = red_mangrove, 
                   color = "red", 
                   radius = 5, 
                   popup = ~paste("Red Mangrove<br>", as.character(geometry))) %>%
  addLegend("bottomright", 
            colors = colors, 
            labels = names(colors), 
            title = "Mangrove Samples")
